Key Arguments: The legislation would undermine freedom of speech and expression in Australia.
The bill contradicts Article 19 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR), which protects the right to hold opinions and freedom of expression.
Recent history during the pandemic has shown suppression of free speech, labeling it as misinformation or disinformation.
Censorship of credible scientific and medical experts has occurred, with governments and bureaucrats taking over the role of conveying public health information.
The bill could further erode public trust in government and threaten democracy in Australia.
Notable Quotes: If passed in its current form, this law would render Australia’s commitment to freedom of speech and expression useless.
Passage of this Bill would further erode our human right to freedom of speech and expression and access to information of all kinds.
If this Bill is passed, I believe the resultant censorship will further erode the public’s collective trust in government and authority and be the death knell to democracy in Australia.
